description:
This is a neat tool. What do y'all think about merging this into a libcloud driver, or contributing to libcloud in addition?
http://libcloud.apache.org/

Mike Nerone is already working on a patch. Y'all could combine forces and keep the future rolling.

(Before Mike there was at least one rejected patch earlier, plus at least one "we didn't submit a patch back".  Getting something into libcloud trunk would make adoption much easier.)
title: libcloud driver

comments.content:
This is a neat tool. What do y'all think about merging this into a libcloud driver, or contributing to libcloud in addition?
http://libcloud.apache.org/

Mike Nerone is already working on a patch. Y'all could combine forces and keep the future rolling.

(Before Mike there was at least one rejected patch earlier, plus at least one "we didn't submit a patch back".  Getting something into libcloud trunk would make adoption much easier.)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~q-noreply

comments.content:
Looks like libcloud has had an OpenStack driver since just before this bug was filed:

  https://github.com/apache/libcloud/commits/trunk/libcloud/compute/drivers/openstack.py

Also, this bug isn't a Nova bug
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc
